text:
The text at
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/core.html#usecanonicalname

"if ServerName is set to www.example.com and Port is set to 9090"

where "Port" is marked as though it was a dírective, is misleading
because Port is in httpd 2.0 no longer a directive.

A suggestion how it could be stated instead:

"if ServerName is set to www,example.com:9000"
creator: erik.sjolund@home.se
slive@apache.org
text:
You are, indeed, correct.  But I find the whole paragraph irrelevant now that
the ServerName and Port are unified, so I'll just delete it.

Thanks for your help!
